main_definition: A period refers to a time frame or the end of menstruation, as well as various idiomatic expressions related to punctuation and length.

meanings_and_examples.example: The music class lasted for one hour.

meanings_and_examples.definition: End of menstrual cycle in females
meanings_and_examples.example: She experienced her period every month around the same time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A punctuation mark used to indicate a pause between parts of a sentence or to separate items in a list
meanings_and_examples.example: The first half of the essay was followed by a period; it introduced the conclusion.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression referring to menstruation, used primarily informally among women and girls
meanings_and_examples.example: She had been on her period for three days now and felt quite uncomfortable.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A long or extensive time or distance; a lengthy duration
meanings_and_examples.example: The journey across the country took several hours, covering a great period of distance.
